hanzi-su-wiki:
仲

Значения

Взаимоотношения, посредничество

Мнемоника

Человек 亻 в середине 中, т.е. посредник.
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhòng
second month of a season; middle; intermediate; second amongst brothers
второй месяц сезона; середина; средний; второй среди братьев

purpleculture_examples:
仲裁 [ zhòng cái ]: arbitration
仲夏 [ zhòng xià ]: midsummer; second month of summer
仲秋 [ zhòng qiū ]: second month of autumn; 8th month of the lunar calendar
伯仲之间 [ bó zhòng zhī jiān ]: almost on a par
大仲马 [ dà zhòng mǎ ]: Alexandre Dumas, père (1802-1870), French writer

heisig_chinese_memo: When negotiating a hostage situation, Mr. T acted as the mid- dle man, or person in the middle, for law enforcement and the terrorist.
koohiiStory1: When negotiating a hostage situation, Mr. T acted as the go-between, or person in the middle, for law enforcement and the terrorist.
koohiiStory2: Go-between The person in the middle.
jp_example_words:
仲人(ちゅうにん): go-between, matchmaker
仲(なか): relation, relationship
仲直り(なかなおり): reconciliation, make peace with
仲間(なかま): company, fellow, colleague, associate, comrade, mate, group, circle of friends, partner
仲良し(なかよし): intimate friend, close friend
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A middle of the road leader is likely to have an average relationship with everyone. He doesn’t really take sides in matters, and just stays in the middle. This makes him seem like sort of a wishy washy people pleaser, and as such his relationships with people are rarely anything more than average.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: I’m sure you’ve heard of “flip-floppers” in politics, or people who try and take both sides of an issue, always staying in the middle ground and never really taking a stand. Imagine one of these people to represent this kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Since this guy doesn’t really have a strong opinion on anything, you find yourself wondering what’s going on in his head. You wish there was a door knocker (なか) on his forehead so you could use the knocker to see if anyone’s home. You could knock and ask why he’s being such a middle of the road leader and give him suggestions about how he could grow a backbone and better his relationships with people.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine your favorite flip-flopper from before. Now imagine that there’s a knocker on his forehead and you get to knock that knocker as hard as you like. Sounds like fun, doesn’t it? Imagine yourself doing this.
Ru_trainchinese: zhòng: (графема) второй (месяц, брат); средний, в середине; Чжун (фамилия)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) is in the middle (中) of his friends
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When negotiating a hostage situation, Mr. T acted as the mid- dle man, or person in the middle, for law enforcement and the terrorist.
humanum_full_description_en:
The "中" of the Jia Jin inscription can be extended to mean the " Zhong " of the first and second one among the brothers. From the early Bronze to "㫃" from " ◎ " from " Shu of" " the expressed orientation", and represents the clear winner " secondary shape" is not from "㫃", to the Spring and Autumn Period began to appear in the case mix. See " in ". The characters of the Qin family of the Warring States period appeared from " person " from " middle ", written as " Zhong ", which is said to be added by the influence of " Bo ". (Refer to "General Explanation of Inscriptions and Forms")

"Said Wen": "Zhong, Zhong Ye. From the people, the voice is also in the middle." In ancient times, " Bo ", " Zhong ", " Uncle ", and " Ji " were used to indicate the ranking of elders and children among brothers. " Zhong " is next to " Bo ", ranking second. "Release name. "Said Kinsman": "Zhong, Zhongye. In Zhongye." Such as "Shangshu. "Lu Xing": "Uncle, uncle, Zhong Shuji, younger son, grandchildren, all listen to what I say, they have a destiny." "Yi Li. "Shi Guan Li": "Zhong, uncle, and season, only what they should be." Zheng Xuan's note: "Bo, Zhong, uncle, and season are called elders and children."

"Bo Zhong" not only refers to the order of brothers, but can also refer to brothers. Such as "Poetry. Xiaoya. "He Rensi": "Bo's family blows health, Zhong's family blows." Zheng Xuanjian: "Bo Zhong, Yu brother also." Tang Dynasty Yuan Zhen's "Writing to the Lady of Hanlin Bai Scholar": "Woo! "By extension, it means that they are comparable to each other. Such as the Three Kingdoms Wei Cao Pi "Dian Lun. "Thesis": "Fu Yi is in Bangu, between the ears of the uncle, but solid and small." Wang Xizhi of the Eastern Jin Dynasty "Book with Xie An": "The mountains and waters in Shu, such as Mount Emei, the summer contains frost and hail. "

" Zhong " is the same as " Zhong ", which also means middle and center. Duan Yucai's note in "Shuowen": "Guzhong and Zhong are interchangeable." Such as "Huainanzi. "Astronomy": "The lunar yin is in the four middles, then the stars travel three places." Gao You's note: "The middle, the middle is also. In the fourth, it is said that the lunar is in the four sides of Mao, You, Zi, and Wu."

Four seasons of the year, three months per season. In ancient times, " Meng ", " Zhong " and " Ji " were used to indicate the arrangement of the months in the four seasons. Therefore, the first month of spring is "Mengchun" and the second month is "Midchun" , The third month is "Jichun". "Yi Zhou Shu. "Zhou Yue": "Anyone who grows up in four seasons, there are spring, summer, autumn and winter, and each has Meng Zhongji's name for ten and two months." For example, "Chu Ci. Chapter Nine. "Sorrowing Ying" "The people separated and lost each other, Fang Zhongchun moved eastward." Wang Yi's note: "Zhongchun, February also."

" Zhong " is also the name of an ancient musical instrument. "Er Ya. "Shi Le": "Daxu is the property, among which it is Zhong, and the small is the Qi." Xing Pingshu: "Xi, the name of the instrument, the name of the instrument is the name of the property, and the other is the name Zhong." "Human Ministry": "Zhong, musical instrument."
humanum_short_description_en: From " people ", from " in ", " in " also sounds. Represents the second among brothers.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文的「中」可引申表示伯仲的「仲」，表示兄弟之中排行第二者。早期金文以從「㫃」從「◎」從「丨」的「中」表示方位，而表示伯仲的「仲」的字形則不從「㫃」，到了春秋時期才開始出現混用的情況。參見「中」。戰國秦系文字出現從「人」從「中」的字形，寫作「仲」，一說是受「伯」的影響所加。（參《金文形義通解》）

　　《說文》：「仲，中也。从人从中，中亦聲。」古代以「伯」、「仲」、「叔」、「季」表示兄弟之間的長幼排行。「仲」次於「伯」，排行第二。《釋名．釋親屬》：「仲，中也。位在中也。」如《尚書．呂刑》：「伯父、伯兄，仲叔季弟，幼子、童孫，皆聽朕言，庶有格命。」《儀禮．士冠禮》：「仲、叔、季，唯其所當。」鄭玄注：「伯、仲、叔、季，長幼之稱。」

　　「伯仲」既表示兄弟的次第，也可以指兄弟。如《詩．小雅．何人斯》：「伯氏吹壎，仲氏吹篪。」鄭玄箋：「伯仲，喻兄弟也。」唐代元稹〈祭翰林白學士太夫人文〉：「嗚呼！分同伯仲，古則拜親。」引申表示彼此不相上下。如三國魏曹丕《典論．論文》：「傅毅之于班固，伯仲之間耳，而固小之。」東晉王羲之〈與謝安書〉：「蜀中山水，如峨眉山，夏含霜雹，碑板之所聞，崑崙之伯仲也。」

　　「仲」同「中」，也表示中間、居中。《說文》段玉裁注：「古中、仲二字互通。」如《淮南子．天文》：「太陰在四仲，則歲星行三宿。」高誘注：「仲，中也。四中，謂太陰在卯、酉、子、午四面之中也。」

　　一年四季，每季三個月，古代以「孟」、「仲」、「季」表示四季裡月份的排列，所以春季的第一個月是「孟春」，第二個月是「仲春」，第三個月是「季春」。《逸周書．周月》：「凡四時成歲，歲有春夏秋冬，各有孟仲季以名十有二月。」如《楚辭．九章．哀郢》「民離散而相失兮，方仲春而東遷。」王逸注：「仲春，二月也。」

　　「仲」也是古樂器名。《爾雅．釋樂》：「大籥謂之產，其中謂之仲，小者謂之箹。」邢昺疏：「籥，樂器名，其大者名產，其中者名仲。」《字彙．人部》：「仲，樂器。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，從「中」，「中」亦聲。表示兄弟之中排行第二者。

仲字的基本解释

仲
zhòng
兄弟排行次序二：仲兄。仲弟。
在当中的：仲春（春季的第二个月，即农历二月。仲夏、仲秋、仲冬依此类推）。仲裁（居间调停、裁判）。
姓。

仲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhòng］
［《廣韻》直衆切，去送，澄。］
“中3”的今字。
(1)中，中间、居中的。
(2)次、第二。指兄弟或姐妹中排行第二者。古时兄弟姐妹排行常以伯（孟）、仲、叔、季为序。
(3)古乐器名。
(4)姓。春秋鲁有仲由。见《左传·定公十二年》。

仲字的英文翻译

◎ 仲
intermediate, middle, second

仲字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　仲； 康熙笔画：6； 页码：页94第11
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?直衆切，蟲去聲。【釋名】父之弟曰仲父。仲，中也，位在中也。【禮·檀弓】幼名，冠字，五十以伯仲。　又樂器。【爾雅·釋樂】大籥謂之產，其中謂之仲，小者謂之箹。　又【水經注】魏明帝鑄銅人二列司馬門外，謂之翁仲。　又姓。高辛氏才子仲堪之後。又仲孫，複姓。　又與中通。仲春亦曰中春，仲子亦曰中子。【前漢·外戚傳】同產兄弟四人，曰子、孟、中、叔。

仲字的源字形

仲字的起名意思

：仲字的本义是指位次居中，含义如同“中”字的本义。仲字又用来表示人的位次，即在兄弟中排行第二的人。

Zhong
Basic explanation of words
Zhong
zhòng
The second order of brothers: Brother Zhong. Brother Zhong.
Among them: Mid-Spring (the second month of spring, which is the second month of the lunar calendar. Mid-summer, mid-autumn, mid-winter and so on). Arbitration (mediation, refereeing).
name.
Zhong
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhòng］
["Guangyun" cut straight to the public, go to send, clear. ]
The present character of "中3".
(1) Middle, middle, centered.
(2) Time, second. Refers to the second-ranked brother or sister. In ancient times, the ranking of brothers and sisters was often in the order of Bo (Meng), Zhong, Uncle, and Ji.
(3) The name of the ancient musical instrument.
(4) Last name. Spring and Autumn Lu has the main reason. See "Zuo Zhuan · Twelve Years of Ding Gong".

Zhong
Source glyph
Zhong
Name meaning
: The original meaning of the word "Zhong" refers to the middle position, and the meaning is the same as the original meaning of the word "中". Zhong is also used to indicate the rank of a person, that is, the person who ranks second among brothers.
会意字。从人(イ),篆书形体像人;从中,指排行居中的人;中(zhong )兼表声。本义是排行第二。

Radicals: ｲ, 中  (leader, middle)
Meaning Mnemonic
A middle of the road leader is likely to have an average relationship with everyone. He doesn’t really take sides in matters, and just stays in the middle. This makes him seem like sort of a wishy washy people pleaser, and as such his relationships with people are rarely anything more than average.
I’m sure you’ve heard of “flip-floppers” in politics, or people who try and take both sides of an issue, always staying in the middle ground and never really taking a stand. Imagine one of these people to represent this kanji.
Reading Mnemonic
Since this guy doesn’t really have a strong opinion on anything, you find yourself wondering what’s going on in his head. You wish there was a door knocker (なか) on his forehead so you could use the knocker to see if anyone’s home. You could knock and ask why he’s being such a middle of the road leader and give him suggestions about how he could grow a backbone and better his relationships with people.
Imagine your favorite flip-flopper from before. Now imagine that there’s a knocker on his forehead and you get to knock that knocker as hard as you like. Sounds like fun, doesn’t it? Imagine yourself doing this.
